Because we of course desire a framework with known and long-standing bugs i=
n it, whose purpose to help others confront and fix their bugs.

Because wh=
en something is flawed, but good enough - we should never strive to make it=
 better for fear that it will spiral out of control because of the dread di=
sease "featuritis". Instead we should learn to accept something, in all of =
its flaws, as "just good enough".

This email brought to you by the letter =
'K' and the number '3'.


Chip
